CONTROLS.TerrainHeightToolsLineOfSightRuler: Terrain Height Tools Line of Sight Ruler
CONTROLS.TerrainHeightToolsTokenLineOfSight: Terrain Height Tools Token Line of Sight

KEYBINDINGS.DecreaseLosRulerHeight: Decrease Line of Sight Ruler Elevation
KEYBINDINGS.IncreaseLosRulerHeight: Increase Line of Sight Ruler Elevation
KEYBINDINGS.ToggleTerrainHeightMapOnTokenLayer: Toggle Terrain Height Map on Token Layer

SETTINGS.DefaultTokenLosHeight.Name: Default Token LoS Height
SETTINGS.DefaultTokenLosHeight.Hint: The default value for the Token Line of Sight tool's token height setting. This determines what height the LoS is drawn from relative to the token. Note that this won't take effect until the next time the players refresh.
SETTINGS.DisplayLosMeasurementGm.Name: Display Line of Sight Ruler (GM)
SETTINGS.DisplayLosMeasurementGm.Hint: Whether to display the GM's line of sight measurement ruler to other connected players or not.
SETTINGS.DisplayLosMeasurementPlayer.Name: Display Line of Sight Ruler (Player)
SETTINGS.DisplayLosMeasurementPlayer.Hint: Whether to display the players' line of sight measurement rulers to other connected players or not.
SETTINGS.OtherUserLineOfSightRulerOpacity.Name: Other Users' LoS Ruler Opacity
SETTINGS.OtherUserLineOfSightRulerOpacity.Hint: How transparent other user's line of sight rulers appear to you.
SETTINGS.ShowTerrainHeightOnTokenLayer: Show Terrain Height Map on Token Layer
SETTINGS.ShowTerrainStackViewerOnTokenLayer.Name: Show Terrain Viewer on Token Layer
SETTINGS.ShowTerrainStackViewerOnTokenLayer.Hint: If turned on, when hovering over terrain while on the token layer, you will see a display showing you what terrain is under your mouse. Alternatively, you can bind this to a key (see 'Configure Controls').
SETTINGS.TerrainHeightLayerRenderAboveTiles.Name: Terrain Height Map Below Tiles
SETTINGS.TerrainHeightLayerRenderAboveTiles.Hint: Whether or not the terrain height map will be drawn below tiles with an elevation of 0 on the scene. Note that the height map will ALWAYS be rendered below tiles with an elevation greater than zero. This setting can be also be configured per-scene.
SETTINGS.TerrainHeightLayerSmartLabelPlacement.Hi: If enabled, will attempt to be smarter about where labels are placed on complex shapes. If disabled, labels will simply appear at the center of the shape, though for concave shapes or shapes with holes this may fall outside the painted area.
SETTINGS.TerrainHeightLayerVisibilityRadius.Name: Terrain Height Map Visibility Radius
SETTINGS.TerrainHeightLayerVisibilityRadius.Hint: How far around the mouse cursor the terrain height map is visible. Use 0 to show the entire map.
SETTINGS.TerrainStackViewerDisplayMode.Name: Terrain Viewer Display Mode
SETTINGS.TerrainStackViewerDisplayMode.Hint: The display mode for the Terrain Viewer. 'Auto' mode will prefer proportional, except for cells with high terrain.
SETTINGS.TerrainTypes.Name: Terrain Types
SETTINGS.TerrainTypes.Hint: Configure what kind of terrain types are available to be drawn to a scene.
SETTINGS.TokenElevationChange.Name: Automatic Token Elevation Change
SETTINGS.TokenElevationChange.Hint: If enabled, when a token moves over the space of a 'solid' terrain type, the elevation of that token will be adjusted to maintain the same elevation-above-surface as before. E.G. if a token was at an elevation of 1 over a ground cell, then moved over a H2 solid terrain, the token's elevation would be adjusted to 3 (i.e. it is still 1 elevation above the surface). Note that for hex grids, this only works with tokens that have a size of 4 grid units or smaller.
SETTINGS.TokenLosToolPreselectToken1.Name: Token LoS: Auto-populate Primary Token
SETTINGS.TokenLosToolPreselectToken1.Hint: If enabled, when selecting the Token Line of Sight tool, will automatically populate the primary token with your owned token (or selected token if you do not own one).
SETTINGS.TokenLosToolPreselectToken2.Name: Token LoS: Auto-populate Secondary Token
SETTINGS.TokenLosToolPreselectToken2.Hint: If enabled, when selecting the Token Line of Sight tool, will automatically populate the secondary token with your first targeted token.
SETTINGS.UseFractionsForLabels.Name: Use Fractions in Labels
SETTINGS.UseFractionsForLabels.Hint: If turned on, values such as 0.5 will be replaced with Â½ when used for terrain labels or ruler heights.

TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.AllowTextRotation.Name: Allow Text Rotation
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.AllowTextRotation.Hint: If turned on, the label may get rotated by 90 degrees if THT thinks that the label will fit better that way.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ClearConfirmContent: Permanently delete all terrain data from this scene?
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ClickToShowHideTerrain: Click on a terrain type to show or hide it from this scene for all players.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.DefaultElevation.Name: Default Elevation
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.DefaultElevation.Hint: If provided, when selecting this terrain type in the paint palette, the painting elevation will be set to this value. You are still able to change it.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.DefaultHeight.Name: Default Height
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.DefaultHeight.Hint: If provided, when selecting this terrain type in the paint palette, the painting height will be set to this value. You are still able to change it.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ElevatedLabelFormat.Name: Elevated Label Format
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ElevatedLabelFormat.Hint: An alternative label format to use when the elevation is not 0. If blank, will use regular label format.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.Elevation.Name: Elevation
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.Elevation.Hint: How far the bottom of the terrain is above the ground
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.EndHeight.Name: End Height
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.EndHeight.Hint: This is the height of the last point of the ruler. You can also adjust this using +/- on the keyboard while dragging the ruler. If not set to anything, uses the same height as the start point.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.EraseBottom.Hint: The lower elevation to erase from. Terrain above this value and below the 'Top' value will be removed.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.EraseTop.Hint: The upper elevation to erase to. Terrain below this value and above the 'Bottom' value will be removed.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.Height.Name: Height
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ImportTerrainTypesPresetHint: Here are some terrain presets that you can quickly import, which have been kindly submitted by the community.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ImportTextPlaceholder: Paste your terrain type export here...
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsAlwaysVisible.Name: Always visible?
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsAlwaysVisible.Hint: If enabled, this terrain will always be shown on the canvas, regardless of whether the user has the terrain visibility turned on or has the vision radius setting turned on. It can still be hidden by scene-level visibility settings.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsSolid.Name: Is solid
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsSolid.Hint: Non-solid terrains are ignored when dragging a token around while the 'Automatic Token Elevation Change' setting is turned on.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsZone.Name: Is zone
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.IsZone.Hint: Zones do not have height or elevation. They are not included in LoS checks by default (but can be included).
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.LabelFormat.Name: Label Format
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.NoTerrainTypesWarn: No terrain types configured. Click to configure.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.AdditiveMerge.Name: Add
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.AdditiveMerge.Hint: Add new terrain to any existing terrain data, without replacing any existing overlapping terrain.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.DestructiveMerge.Name: Replace
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.DestructiveMerge.Hint: Add new terrain to any existing terrain data, replacing any existing overlapping terrain.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.TotalReplace.Name: Clear
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.PaintMode.TotalReplace.Hint: Replace the cell entirely with the new terrain data.

Placeholders.Elevation: The elevation of the terrain (how far it is off the ground).
Placeholders.Height: The height (vertical size) of the terrain.
Placeholders.PlaceholderHelpText: You can use any of these placeholders in the label format, which will get replaced with the corresponding value:
Placeholders.Top: The elevation of the top of the terrain (elevation + height).

TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.SameTokenSelected: You have already selected this token for line of sight, please select a different one
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.SelectAShapeCopyHint: There are multiple shapes at this location. Please select one whose configuration will be copied.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.SelectAShapeConvertHint: There are multiple shapes at this location. Please select one to convert.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.SelectAShapeEraseHint: There are multiple shapes at this location. Please select one to erase.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.ShapeConversionHint: Click on a shape on the canvas to convert it.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.MissingLibWrapperWarning: Terrain Height Tools now requires the libWrapper module to work. Please ensure it is installed and enabled or you may encounter issues.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.StartHeight.Name: Start Height
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.StartHeight.Hint: This is the height of the first point of the ruler. You can also adjust this using +/- on the keyboard before starting to drag the ruler.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.TokenLineOfSightConfigHint: Select two tokens to measure line of sight between them.
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.TokenLineOfSightRelativeRayPosition: Position of ray relative to the token. Currently: {current}
TERRAINHEIGHTTOOLS.TokenLineOfSightSelectTokenHint: Click on a token to select it, or click on the 'Select token' button again to cancel
